void TTEOutput::handleMessage ( cMessage *  msg  )  [protected, virtual]

Forwards the messages from the different buffers and LLC according to the TTEthernet specification.

Time-triggered messages are send immediately, rate-constrained and best-effort messages are delayed if they do not fit in the gap until the next time-triggered message. If the lower layer is idle messages are picked from the queues according to the priorities. Time-triggered buffers can free the bandwidth reservation mechanism by sending a TTBufferEmpty message.

Parameters:
msg the incoming message

Definition at line 30 of file TTEOutput.cc.

00035         ASSERT(framesRequested > 0);
00036         ASSERT(framesRequested == 1);
00037         //TODO Hier überprüfen ob das so ok ist, insbesondere müssen die Buffer auch "leere" messages schicken damit der Buffer weiter gesetzt wird!

00042         {
00043             if (framesRequested)
00044             {
00045                 framesRequested--;

00048             delete msg;
00049         }

00063         }
00064     }

00066     {
00067         if (framesRequested && isTransmissionAllowed((EtherFrame*) msg))
00068         {
00069             framesRequested--;
00070 
00071             //Reset Bag
00072             RCBuffer *rcBuffer = dynamic_cast<RCBuffer*> (msg->getSenderModule());
00073             if (rcBuffer)
00074                 rcBuffer->resetBag();
00075             send(msg, gateBaseId("out"));

00080             if (priority > 0 && priority < NUM_RC_PRIORITIES)
00081             {
00082                 rcQueue[priority].insert(msg);
00083             }
00084             else
00085             {
00086                 rcQueue[0].insert(msg);
00087                 ev << "Priority missing!" << endl;

00089         }
00090     }
00091     //Frames arrived on in are best-effort frames
00092     else if (msg->arrivedOn("in"))
00093     {
00094         // If there are framesRequested the MAC layer is currently idle
00095         if (framesRequested && isTransmissionAllowed((EtherFrame*) msg))
00096         {
00097             framesRequested--;
00098             send(msg, gateBaseId("out"));
00099         }
00100         else
00101         {
00102             beQueue.insert(msg);
00103             emit(beQueueLengthSignal, beQueue.length());

bool TTEOutput::isTransmissionAllowed ( EtherFrame *  message  )  [private, virtual]

Helper function to check whether a Messages is allowed to be transmitted.

The function checks whether a message fits in the gap until the next TT-message should be transmitted. It uses the message length to calculate the transmission duration.

Parameters:
message The message that should be transmitted
Returns:
true if transmission is allowed else false

void TTEOutput::requestPacket (  )  [protected, virtual]

this method is invoked when the underlying mac is idle.

When this method is invoked the module sends a new message when there is one. Else it saves the state and sends the message immediately when it is received.

Definition at line 147 of file TTEOutput.cc.

00181     //BEFrames
00182     if (!beQueue.isEmpty() && isTransmissionAllowed((EtherFrame*) beQueue.front()))
00183     {
00184         framesRequested--;
00185         send((cMessage*) beQueue.pop(), gateBaseId("out"));
00186         emit(beQueueLengthSignal, beQueue.length());
